result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • John L Domine was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 89 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA Surcharge and Sample WAIVED.

Court Costs and Fee to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Delafield Police Department as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor within 60 days of release.

Count #2 was Dismissed.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel Meeting while on Extended Supervision.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John L Domine in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 8 years (Initial Confinement: 4 years, Extended Supervision: 4 years) Credit for 89 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Delafield Police Department
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 3 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor within 60 days of release.
Sentencing Memorandum for John Domine
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant John L Domine in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information and waives further reading.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defense requests matter be set for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on April 2, 2015 at 09:30 am.
